intro: Serapias feldwegiana, commonly known as the Feldweg's sandwort, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial plant that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, with yellow flowers that have five petals and numerous stamens. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as coastal dunes or rocky slopes. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
